verses.verse: "I made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> how then should I look <S%H995><s%> lustfully at a young woman? <S%H1330><s%>
For what is the portion <S%H2506><s%> from God <S%H433><s%> above, <S%H4605><s%> and the heritage <S%H5159><s%> from the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> on high? <S%H4791><s%>
Is it not calamity <S%H343><s%> to the unrighteous, <S%H5767><s%> and disaster <S%H5235><s%> to the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity? <S%H205><s%>
Doesn't <S%H7200><s%> he see my ways, <S%H1870><s%> and number <S%H5608><s%> all my steps? <S%H6806><s%>
"If I have walked <S%H1980><s%> with falsehood, <S%H7723><s%> and my foot <S%H7272><s%> has hurried <S%H2363><s%> to deceit <S%H4820><s%>
(let me be weighed <S%H8254><s%> in an even <S%H6664><s%> balance, <S%H3976><s%> that God <S%H433><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> my integrity <S%H8538><s%>);

if my step <S%H838><s%> has turned out <S%H5186><s%> of the way, <S%H1870><s%> if my heart <S%H3820><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> if any defilement <S%H3971><s%> has stuck <S%H1692><s%> to my hands, <S%H3709><s%>
then let me sow, <S%H2232><s%> and let another <S%H312><s%> eat. <S%H398><s%> Yes, <S%H6631><s%> let the produce of my field be rooted out. <S%H8327><s%>
"If my heart <S%H3820><s%> has been enticed <S%H6601><s%> to a woman, <S%H802><s%> and I have laid wait <S%H693><s%> at my neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s door, <S%H6607><s%>
then let my wife <S%H802><s%> grind <S%H2912><s%> for another, <S%H312><s%> and let others <S%H312><s%> sleep with her. <S%H3766><s%>
For that would be a heinous crime. <S%H2154><s%> Yes, <S%H5771><s%> it would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges: <S%H6414><s%>
For it is a fire <S%H784><s%> that consumes <S%H398><s%> to destruction, <S%H11><s%> and would root out <S%H8327><s%> all my increase. <S%H8393><s%>
"If I have despised <S%H3988><s%> the cause <S%H4941><s%> of my male <S%H5650><s%> servant or of my female <S%H519><s%> servant, <S%H7379><s%> when they contended with me;
What then shall I do <S%H6213><s%> when God <S%H410><s%> rises up? <S%H6965><s%> When he visits, <S%H6485><s%> what shall I answer him? <S%H7725><s%>
Didn't <S%H6213><s%> he who made me in the womb <S%H990><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> him? <S%H259><s%> Didn't one fashion <S%H3559><s%> us in the womb? <S%H7358><s%>
"If I have withheld <S%H4513><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> from their desire, <S%H2656><s%> or have caused the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the widow <S%H490><s%> to fail, <S%H3615><s%>
or have eaten <S%H398><s%> my morsel <S%H6595><s%> alone, <S%H3490><s%> and the fatherless has not eaten of it <S%H398><s%>
(no, <S%H5271><s%> from my youth he grew up <S%H1431><s%> with me as with a father, <S%H1><s%> her have I guided <S%H5148><s%> from my mother <S%H517><s%>'s womb <S%H990><s%>);
if I have seen <S%H7200><s%> any perish <S%H6><s%> for want of clothing, <S%H3830><s%> or that the needy <S%H34><s%> had no covering; <S%H3682><s%>
if his heart <S%H2504><s%> hasn't <S%H1288><s%> blessed me, <S%H2552><s%> if he hasn't been warmed with my sheep <S%H3532><s%>'s fleece; <S%H1488><s%>
if I have lifted up <S%H5130><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> because I saw <S%H7200><s%> my help <S%H5833><s%> in the gate, <S%H8179><s%>
then let my shoulder fall <S%H5307><s%> from the shoulder blade, <S%H7929><s%> and my arm <S%H248><s%> be broken <S%H7665><s%> from the bone. <S%H7070><s%>
For calamity <S%H343><s%> from God <S%H410><s%> is a terror <S%H6343><s%> to me. <S%H7613><s%> Because his majesty, I can do nothing. <S%H3201><s%>
"If I have made <S%H7760><s%> gold <S%H2091><s%> my hope, <S%H3689><s%> and have said <S%H559><s%> to the fine gold, <S%H3800><s%> <S%H4009><s%> 'You are my confidence;'
If I have rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> because my wealth <S%H2428><s%> was great, <S%H7227><s%> and because my hand <S%H3027><s%> had gotten <S%H4672><s%> much; <S%H3524><s%>
if I have seen <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H216><s%> when it shined, <S%H1984><s%> or the moon <S%H3394><s%> moving <S%H1980><s%> in splendor, <S%H3368><s%>
and my heart <S%H3820><s%> has been secretly <S%H5643><s%> enticed, <S%H6601><s%> and my hand <S%H3027><s%> threw a kiss <S%H5401><s%> from my mouth, <S%H6310><s%>
this also would be an iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to be punished by the judges; <S%H6416><s%> for I should have denied <S%H3584><s%> the God <S%H410><s%> who is above. <S%H4605><s%>
"If I have rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> at the destruction <S%H6365><s%> of him who hated <S%H8130><s%> me, <S%H5782><s%> or lifted up myself when evil <S%H7451><s%> found him; <S%H4672><s%>
(yes, <S%H5414><s%> I have not allowed my mouth <S%H2441><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%> by asking <S%H7592><s%> his life <S%H5315><s%> with a curse <S%H423><s%>);
if the men <S%H4962><s%> of my tent <S%H168><s%> have not said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H5414><s%> 'Who can find one who has not been filled <S%H7646><s%> with his meat? <S%H1320><s%>'
(the foreigner <S%H1616><s%> has not lodged <S%H3885><s%> in the street, <S%H2351><s%> but I have opened <S%H6605><s%> my doors <S%H1817><s%> to the traveler <S%H734><s%>);
if like Adam <S%H121><s%> I have covered <S%H3680><s%> my transgressions, <S%H6588><s%> by hiding <S%H2934><s%> my iniquity <S%H5771><s%> in my heart, <S%H2243><s%>

because I feared <S%H6206><s%> the great <S%H7227><s%> multitude, <S%H1995><s%> and the contempt <S%H937><s%> of families <S%H4940><s%> terrified <S%H2865><s%> me, <S%H1826><s%> so that I kept silence, and didn't <S%H3318><s%> go out of the door <S%H6607><s%>â€”

oh that <S%H5414><s%> I had one to hear <S%H8085><s%> me! <S%H8420><s%> (behold, here is my signature, let the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> me <S%H376><s%>); let the accuser write <S%H3789><s%> my indictment! <S%H5612><s%>
Surely I would carry <S%H5375><s%> it on my shoulder; <S%H7926><s%> and I would bind <S%H6029><s%> it to me as a crown. <S%H5850><s%>
I would declare <S%H5046><s%> to him the number <S%H4557><s%> of my steps. <S%H6806><s%> as a prince <S%H5057><s%> would I go near to him. <S%H7126><s%>
If my land <S%H127><s%> cries <S%H2199><s%> out against me, <S%H3162><s%> and its furrows <S%H8525><s%> weep together; <S%H1058><s%>
if I have eaten <S%H398><s%> its fruits <S%H3581><s%> without money, <S%H3701><s%> or have caused its owners <S%H1167><s%> to lose <S%H5301><s%> their life, <S%H5315><s%>

let briars <S%H2336><s%> grow <S%H3318><s%> instead of wheat, <S%H2406><s%> and stinkweed <S%H890><s%> instead of barley. <S%H8184><s%>" The words <S%H1697><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> are ended. <S%H8552><s%>
